abolish.author: John Dewey
abolish.quotation: The only way to abolish war is to make peace seem heroic.

abolishment.author: Abraham Lincoln
abolishment.quotation: I am a little uneasy about the abolishment of slavery in this District of Columbia.

abolition.author: Karl Marx
abolition.quotation: The theory of Communism may be summed up in the single sentence: Abolition of private property.

abolitionist.author: Abraham Lincoln
abolitionist.quotation: I have always hated slavery, I think as much as any Abolitionist.

absorb.author: Bruce Lee
absorb.quotation: Absorb what is useful, reject what is useless, add what is specifically your own.

accommodate.author: George Herbert
accommodate.quotation: Patience, time and money accommodate all things.

accurate.author: Bren√© Brown
accurate.quotation: Vulnerability is our most accurate measurement of courage.

acknowledge.author: Nikos Kazantzakis
acknowledge.quotation: Never acknowledge the limitations of man. Smash all boundaries! Deny whatever your eyes see. Die every moment, but say: Death does not exist.

adder.author: Hilda Doolittle
adder.quotation: I fear no man, no woman; flower does not fear bird, insect nor adder.

adhere.author: Chuck D
adhere.quotation: I adhere to the philosophy, "I don't care who writes the laws, let me write the songs".

adverse.author: Shiv Khera
adverse.quotation: Under Adverse conditions - some people break down,some break records.

advocate.author: Ulysses S. Grant
advocate.quotation: I have never advocated war except as a means of peace.

aesthetic.author: George Edward Woodberry
aesthetic.quotation: Aesthetic freedom is like free speech; it is, indeed, a form of free speech.

affinity.author: Guy Pearce
affinity.quotation: I grew up with such an affinity to cats. I adore the way that they think and operate.

affirm.author: Aberjhani
affirm.quotation: Quote words that affirm all men and women are your brothers and sisters.

aid.author: Rand Paul
aid.quotation: Foreign aid goes from poor people in rich countries to rich people in poor countries.

albeit.author: Christopher Marlowe
albeit.quotation: Virginity, albeit some highly prize it, Compared with marriage, had you tried them both, Differs as much as wine and water doth.

all through.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
all through.quotation: All through life a man has need of a counsellor and guide.

ambulance.author: Frank Buckles
ambulance.quotation: My job driving the ambulance was not very severe, you did what you were supposed to do. That was my main job.

amend.author: Bible
amend.quotation: Amend your ways and your doings.

and so {on!forth}.author: Ronald Reagan
and so {on!forth}.quotation: I do not believe in taking away the right of the citizen for sporting, for hunting and so forth, or for home defense. But I do believe that an AK-47, a machine gun, is not a sporting weapon or needed for defense of a home.

apart from.author: Marc Bekoff
apart from.quotation: Humans are a part of nature, not apart from nature.

appoint.author: Aesop
appoint.quotation: We hang the petty thieves and appoint the great ones to public office.

appointee.author: Josh Marshall.
appointee.quotation: There's a difference, though, between being a political appointee and putting a political operative in charge of a U.S. attorney's office.

appointment.author: Nhat Hanh
appointment.quotation: Our appointment with life is in the present moment. If we do not have peace and joy right now, when will we have peace and joy?

as far as.author: Albert Einstein
as far as.quotation: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain, and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.

as far as {someone!something} {be} conce.author: Albert Einstein
as far as {someone!something} {be} conce.quotation: As far as I'm concerned, I prefer silent vice to ostentatious virtue.

as far back as {someone} can remember.author: Al Pacino
as far back as {someone} can remember.quotation: Drinking and smoking grass were a part of my life as far back as I can remember.

aspect.author: Nora Roberts
aspect.quotation: The most important aspect of any story, to me, is character.

assent.author: Ray Krone
assent.quotation: The death penalty doesn't need your assent to continue ... it needs your indifference.

at all.author: Aesop
at all.quotation: If you can't say anything nice, then don't say anything at all.

atrocity.author: Masai Ujiri
atrocity.quotation: What is happening in Nigeria is an absolute atrocity.

basement.author: Mike Trout
basement.quotation: No curfew. I live in the basement. I got everything I need. Home cooking ... it's awesome.

being.author: Aaron Carter
being.quotation: The main thing in life is not to be afraid of being human.

benefit.author: Alan Autry
benefit.quotation: Leadership requires the courage to make decisions that will benefit the next generation.

besides.author: Jake LaMotta
besides.quotation: Besides Bob Satterfield, the only ones who ever hurt me were my ex-wives.

betray.author: Aesop
betray.quotation: Betray a friend, and you'll often find you have ruined yourself.

bias.author: K.K. Raghava
bias.quotation: I can't promise my child a life without bias - we're all biased - but I promise to bias my child with multiple perspectives.

bite.author: Marilyn Monroe
bite.quotation: Dogs never bite me - just humans.

bleed.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
bleed.quotation: Words are alive; cut them and they bleed.

breakthrough.author: Bill Gates
breakthrough.quotation: A breakthrough in machine learning would be worth ten Microsofts.

bride.author: Kabir
bride.quotation: When the bride is one with her lover, who cares about the wedding party?

broaden.author: Bruce Chatwin
broaden.quotation: Travel doesn't merely broaden the mind. It makes the mind.

by themselves.author: Mark Twain
by themselves.quotation: Thousands of geniuses live and die undiscovered - either by themselves or by others.

capital punishment.author: Henry Ford
capital punishment.quotation: Capital punishment is as fundamentally wrong as a cure for crime as charity is wrong as a cure for poverty.

cardiac arrest.author: Samuel Shem
cardiac arrest.quotation: At a cardiac arrest, the first procedure is to take your own pulse.

chamber.author: Jimi Hendrix
chamber.quotation: There'll be no smoking in the gas chamber.

climb.author: Royal Robbins
climb.quotation: Before the deed comes the thought. Before the achievement comes the dream. Every mountain we climb, we first climb in our mind.

commit.author: Voltaire
commit.quotation: As long as people believe in absurdities they will continue to commit atrocities.

compassion.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
compassion.quotation: Compassion is not weakness, and concern for the unfortunate is not socialism.

conscious.author: Elia Kazan
conscious.quotation: I was always a self-conscious person.

consist.author: George Bernard Shaw
consist.quotation: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.

content.author: Chuck Palahniuk
content.quotation: May I never be complete. May I never be content. May I never be perfect.

contrariwise.author: Lewis Carroll
contrariwise.quotation: Contrariwise, if it was so, it might be; and if it were so, it would be; but as it isn't, it ain't. That's logic.

contrary.author: Saint Augustine
contrary.quotation: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.

contrast.author: Rita Ora
contrast.quotation: I have always liked the contrast between being blonde and having dark features.

counterpart.author: Robert M
counterpart.quotation: Our soul should be a mirror of Christ; we should reflect every feature: for every grace in Christ there should be a counterpart in us.

courage.author: Mark Twain
courage.quotation: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear ‚Äì not absence of fear.

courageous.author: Matt Cullen
courageous.quotation: Courageous people are not afraid to fail. So often in life and in sports, we're afraid to fail. Instead, we should attack things with excitement and enthusiasm and think about the positives as opposed to the negatives.

courageously.author: Ovid
courageously.quotation: Happy are those who dare courageously to defend what they love.

death.author: Leonardo da Vinci
death.quotation: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.

decline.author: William Faulkner
decline.quotation: I decline to accept the end of man.

deed.author: Benjamin Franklin
deed.quotation: It takes many good deeds to build a good reputation, and only one bad one to lose it.

deliver.author: John Ford
deliver.quotation: You can speak well if your tongue can deliver the message of your heart.

deliver on.author: Marty Feldman
deliver on.quotation: Hookers have to deliver on their promise... unlike politicians.

delivery.author: Kenneth Lay
delivery.quotation: We use competitive markets to arrange for delivery of our food supply.

deprive.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
deprive.quotation: Never deprive someone of hope; it might be all they have.

discrepancy.author: Dalai Lama
discrepancy.quotation: Have no discrepancy between what you say, what you are and what you do.

disturb.author: Proverbs
disturb.quotation: Small children disturb your sleep, big children your life.

dominate.quotation: The stronger must dominate and not blend with the weaker, thus sacrificing his own greatness.

elevate.quotation: Stephen Harper is probably the most dangerous human being ever elevated to power in Canada.

elevating.quotation: Arithmetic has a very great and elevating effect, compelling the soul to reason about abstract number, and rebelling against the introduction of visible or tangible objects into the argument.

elevation.quotation: There is no reason against woman's elevation, but prejudices.

elevator.quotation: Life is like an elevator. Up and down, just make sure you get off on the right floor.

embellish.author: Jean Paul
embellish.quotation: Nothing can embellish a beautiful face more than a narrow band that indicates a small wound drawn cross wise over the brow.

emergency.author: James Douglas, Lord of Douglas
emergency.quotation: Care shouldn't start in the emergency room.

erupt.author: Charles Lindbergh
erupt.quotation: What makes human power erupt like a volcano? What destroy's it? The civilizations of Rome, Greece, Egypt, China were all eruptions from a human core.

essence.author: Vincent Van Gogh
essence.quotation: Love is something eternal ‚Äî the aspect may change but not the essence.

evaluate.author: Tony Gaskins
evaluate.quotation: Evaluate the people in your life; then promote, demote, or terminate. You're the CEO of your life!

exaggerate.author: Anonymous
exaggerate.quotation: Man is inclined to exaggerate almost everything - except his own mistakes.

exert.quotation: The best way in which women can exert their power is in being late for an appointment, or in not keeping it at all.

expect.author: Sylvia Plath
expect.quotation: If you expect nothing from somebody you are never disappointed.

extreme.quotation: The most powerful tool to lift families out of extreme poverty is to grant micro-loans to women.

famine.quotation: The Irish famine of 1846 killed more than 1,000,000 people, but it killed poor devils only. To the wealth of the country it did not the slightest damage.

far less.author: Warren Buffett
far less.quotation: Take the high road; it's far less crowded.

farmhouse.author: Robert Brault
farmhouse.quotation: A child on a farm sees a plane fly overhead and dreams of a faraway place. A traveler on the plane sees the farmhouse below and dreams of home.

feel free.author: Neil Bauman
feel free.quotation: Please feel free to post this if you have the gonads.

flatmate.author: Michael Caine
flatmate.quotation: In the sixties, everyone you knew became famous. My flatmate was Terence Stamp. My barber was Vidal Sassoon. David Hockney did the menu in a restaurant I went to. I didn't know anyone unknown who didn't become famous.

for instance.quotation: My luck is getting worse and worse. Last night, for instance, I was mugged by a quaker.

forehead.author: Jennifer Aniston
forehead.quotation: You know, I've got wrinkles on my forehead and smile lines, but what's wrong with that? I love to smile.

foresee.quotation: Your task is not to foresee the future, but to enable it.

forever.quotation: I want you to be forever strong on the field, so that you will be forever strong off the field.

fortune.author: Adolf Hitler
fortune.quotation: What good fortune for governments that the people do not think.

furnish.author: Hinton R. Helper
furnish.quotation: California can and does furnish the best bad things that are obtainable in America.

furthermore.author: Vladimir Lenin
furthermore.quotation: A revolution is impossible without a revolutionary situation; furthermore, not every revolutionary situation leads to revolution.

fury.author: John Dryden
fury.quotation: Beware of the fury of the patient man.

get older.quotation: Time makes you bolder, children get older. I'm getting older, too.

get through.quotation: You can get through life with bad manners, but it's easier with good manners.

get through to.quotation: Educating a child won't be difficult if you get through to the parent.

govern.quotation: It is far better to be free to govern or misgovern yourself than to be governed by anybody else.

handkerchief.author: Anne Sullivan Macy
handkerchief.quotation: I'd rather break stones on the king's highway than hem a handkerchief.

having to.quotation: Style is a way to say who you are without having to speak.

hear out.author: Rand Paul
hear out.quotation: If you hear me out, I believe you'll discover that what motivates me more than any other issue is the defense of everyone's rights.

heated.quotation: If you are cold, tea will warm you. If you are too heated, it will cool you. If you are depressed, it will cheer you. If you are excited, it will calm you.

homestead.author: John C. Hawkes
homestead.quotation: My father's parents were Irish. Only a year before my father died, he and I went back to Ireland for a week to look at the old homestead.

hurt.author: Proverbs
hurt.quotation: When there is no enemy within, the enemies outside cannot hurt you.

hype.author: Flavor Flav
hype.quotation: The hype man's job is to get everybody out of their seats and on the dance floor to have a good time.

illiterate.quotation: If you're totally illiterate and living on one dollar a day, the benefits of globalization never come to you.

in [actual] fact.quotation: In fact I always disliked conceptual art, because my work is about anarchistic humor.

in addition to {something}.quotation: In addition to English, at least one ancient language, probably Greek or Hebrew, and two modern languages would be required.

in contrast to.author: Sigmund Freud
in contrast to.quotation: The ego represents what we call reason and sanity, in contrast to the id which contains the passions.

in order to.author: R. C. Sproul
in order to.quotation: God is not going to negotiate His holiness... in order to accommodate us.

in someone's opinion.quotation: In my opinion, the M1 rifle is the greatest battle implement ever devised.

in what.author: Charles Spurgeon
in what.quotation: My faith rests not in what I am, or shall be, or feel, or know, but in what Christ is, in what he has done, and in what he is doing for me.

in-depth.author: Benjamin Carson
in-depth.quotation: If we develop in-depth knowledge it will enable us to give our best to others and help to make a better world.

inconsistency.author: Susan B Anthony.
inconsistency.quotation: Inconsistency is the jewel of the American people.

inequality.quotation: Of all the forms of inequality, injustice in health care is the most shocking and inhumane.

inhibit.author: George Shearing
inhibit.quotation: Having a set, popular formula does inhibit you.

instant.quotation: Everybody is looking for instant success, but it doesn't work that way. You build a successful life one day at a time.

interfere.quotation: The most important thing to do in your life is to not interfere with somebody else's life.

interior.author: Rick Owens
interior.quotation: Every jacket I make has interior pockets big enough to store a book and a sandwich and a passport.

intolerance.quotation: Never again war! Never again hatred and intolerance!

intrusive.quotation: Salary stories are intrusive. Do you ask your neighbour what they earn for their job?

intrusively.quotation: Sarcasm: the last refuge of modest and chaste-souled people when the privacy of their soul is coarsely and intrusively invaded.

intrusiveness.quotation: We have seen an outrageous increase in the size, scope, and intrusiveness of the federal government.

jail.quotation: You can jail a Revolutionary, but you can't jail the Revolution.

jewel.author: Bible
jewel.quotation: As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.

justify.quotation: Men use thought only to justify their wrong doings, and employ speech only to conceal their thoughts.

kick in.author: Dwayne Johnson
kick in.quotation: When you walk up to opportunities door... don't knock it. Kick that bitch in, smile and introduce yourself.

kick in the teeth.quotation: You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.

kindness.author: Jewel
kindness.quotation: In the end only kindness matters.

lack.author: Leo Tolstoy
lack.quotation: Do not fear the lack of knowledge, fear false knowledge.

landowner.author: Antoine Lavoisier
landowner.quotation: A wealthy landowner cannot cultivate and improve his farm without spreading comfort and well-being around him. Rich and abundant crops, a numerous population and a prosperous countryside are the rewards for his efforts.

lasting.quotation: Lasting love extends grace. No relationship will make it without grace.

lethal.quotation: Complacent ignorance is the most lethal sickness of the soul.

manifoldness.author: Charles Proteus Steinmetz
manifoldness.quotation: In a mathematical sense, space is manifoldness, or combination of numbers. Physical space is known as the 3-dimension system. There is the 4-dimension system, there is the 10-dimension system.

measure.author: Brian Tracy
measure.quotation: The true measure of the value of any business leader and manager is performance.

mention.author: Larry Wall
mention.quotation: I won't mention any names, because I don't want to get sun4's into trouble...

merely.author: Albert Einstein
merely.quotation: The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.

mistakenly.author: Jeanette Winterson
mistakenly.quotation: I don't know which is worse: to be wrongfully accused or mistakenly understood.

mostly.quotation: Tennis is mostly mental. You win or lose the match before you even go out there.

mother-in-law.author: Sin-Itiro Tomonaga
mother-in-law.quotation: ...a bride who is bullied by her mother-in-law will herself become a bad mother-in-law.

murder.quotation: War is organized murder and torture against our brothers.

narrow.author: Anonymous
narrow.quotation: The open-minded see the truth in different things: the narrow-minded see only the differences.

naturally.author: Amanda Seyfried
naturally.quotation: I was naturally skinny and had braces, so I wasn't a cute model.

needless.author: Confucius
needless.quotation: Things that are done, it is needless to speak about...things that are past, it is needless to blame.

next to.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
next to.quotation: Next to God we are nothing. To God we are Everything.

no doubt.author: John Dalton
no doubt.quotation: This paper will no doubt be found interesting by those who take an interest in it.

nobility.author: Portia de Rossi
nobility.quotation: True nobility isn't about being better than anyone else; it's about being better than you used to be.

note-taking.author: Wanda Koop
note-taking.quotation: As a painter, taking photos is a form of shorthand - note-taking.

off-putting.author: Kate Bosworth
off-putting.quotation: I don't want to broadcast my personal life because I feel it's off-putting.

offense.author: Cicero
offense.quotation: Let the punishment match the offense.

on the contrary.quotation: Comfort is no test of truth; on the contrary, truth is often far from being comfortable.

on the other hand.quotation: Change brings opportunities. On the other hand, change can be confusing.

once upon a time.author: John D. Barrow
once upon a time.quotation: Once upon a time there was no Time.

oppress.author: Cesar Chavez
oppress.quotation: You cannot oppress the people who are not afraid anymore.

or else.quotation: A friend to everybody is often a friend to nobody, or else in his simplicity he robs his family to help strangers, and becomes brother to a beggar. There is wisdom in generosity, as in everything else.

orb.author: William Shakespeare
orb.quotation: Foolery, sir, does walk about the orb like the sun; it shines everywhere.

outline.quotation: After we made love he took a piece of chalk and made an outline of my body.

outrage.author: Herodotus
outrage.quotation: There is nothing more foolish, nothing more given to outrage than a useless mob.

outside.author: Nicolas Manetta
outside.quotation: Those who do not think outside the box are easily contained.

over time.quotation: A lot of things in history change over time.

over whether.quotation: Scientifically, there's no debate over whether the fetus is alive and human.

penalty.quotation: If the death penalty is to be abolished, let those gentlemen, the murderers, do it first.

pesky.author: Chuck Eddy
pesky.quotation: I'm that grumpy old guy yelling at all those pesky little Grizzly Bear fans to get offa my lawn.

petty.quotation: Don't be so petty. Sometimes you have to do business with people you don't like. It doesn't mean you have to be like them or like them.

plenty.author: Joey Comeau
plenty.quotation: There are plenty of fish in the sea, if I run out of women.

plot.author: J. K. Rowling
plot.quotation: I always have a basic plot outline, but I like to leave some things to be decided while I write.

point out.quotation: I know my flaws before other people point them out to me.

polish.author: Charles Caleb Colton
polish.quotation: Courage is like the diamond, ‚Äî very brilliant; not changed by fire, capable of high polish, but except for the purpose of cutting hard bodies useless.

pond.author: Nick Lowe
pond.quotation: I like being a big fish in a small pond. I'm not interested in a huge audience because it brings headaches.

ponder.author: St. Catherine of Siena
ponder.quotation: Ponder the fact that God has made you a gardener, to root out vice and plant virtue.

porch.author: Abraham Lincoln
porch.quotation: Two of my favorite things are sitting on my front porch smoking a pipe of sweet hemp, and playing my Hohner harmonica.

poverty.author: Nelson Mandela
poverty.quotation: While poverty persists, there is no true freedom.

precious.author: Benjamin Disraeli
precious.quotation: Time is precious, but truth is more precious than time.

rarely.author: Dale Carnegie
rarely.quotation: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.

ray.author: Isaac Stern
ray.quotation: Mozart's music is like an X-ray of your soul - it shows what is there, and what isn't.

recapitulate.quotation: As far as what I do, my value as a writer is certainly not to try to recapitulate a 19th century form. Certain styles of narrative don't conform to my style of experiencing the world.

refund.author: Meyer Lansky
refund.quotation: Always overpay your taxes.That way you'll get a refund.

regardless.author: Josh Thomson
regardless.quotation: Live your life with a smile regardless the circumstances.

regardless of.author: Malcolm X
regardless of.quotation: I believe in human beings, and that all human beings should be respected as such, regardless of their color.

rehabilitate.quotation: Prisons don't rehabilitate, they don't punish, they don't protect, so what the hell do they do?

reluctance.author: Kate Morton
reluctance.quotation: Reluctance to begin is quick to befriend procrastination.

repeatedly.author: Aristotle
repeatedly.quotation: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

resist.author: Bible
resist.quotation: Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

revolt.author: Juvenal
revolt.quotation: Give them bread and circuses and they will never revolt

ripple.author: Lee J. Colan
ripple.quotation: A single act does make a difference... it creates a ripple effect that can be felt many miles and people away.

rock up.author: Katy B
rock up.quotation: The days of an open mic night when I'd rock up in an old jumper are over.

royal.author: Anthony Trollope
royal.quotation: There is no royal road to learning; no short cut to the acquirement of any art.

ruthless.author: George S. Patton
ruthless.quotation: War is very simple, direct, and ruthless. It takes a simple, direct, and ruthless man to wage war.

scale.author: James Russell Lowell
scale.quotation: In the scale of the destinies, brawn will never weigh so mach as brain.

scare.author: Elmer Davis
scare.quotation: The first and great commandment is, don't let them scare you.

scatter.author: Anonymous
scatter.quotation: It takes 8,460 bolts to assemble an automobile, and one nut to scatter it all over the road.

seniority.author: Meryl Streep
seniority.quotation: I'm older. There's some sort of seniority. As a matter of fact, the seniority ebbs as you get older.

sheet.author: Thomas A. Edison
sheet.quotation: Tomorrow Is My Exam But I Don‚Äôt Care Because A Single Sheet Of Paper Can‚Äôt Decide My Future

should be.author: Christian Bale
should be.quotation: I tend to think you're fearless when you recognize why you should be scared of things, but do them anyway.

show off.author: Bruce Lee
show off.quotation: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.

single out.author: Usain Bolt
single out.quotation: I never single out any one competitor. I treat all my rivals equally.

slavery.author: Abraham Lincoln
slavery.quotation: Where slavery is, there liberty cannot be; and where liberty is, there slavery cannot be.

so-called.quotation: This so-called contemporary art is not a form, but a philosophy of society.

spectacle.author: Guy Debord
spectacle.quotation: The Mafia is not an outsider in this world; it is perfectly at home. Indeed, in the integrated spectacle it stands as the model of all advanced commercial enterprises.

spot.author: William Poundstone
spot.quotation: Samuelson spotted a mistake in Bacheliers work. Bachelier's model had failed to consider that stock prices cannot fall below zero.

stranger.author: Taylor Swift
stranger.quotation: When I meet my fans, it's not like meeting a stranger. It's like saying hello to someone that I already know.

surround.author: Doreen Virtue
surround.quotation: Surround yourself with positive people and situations, and avoid negativity.

sympathize.quotation: I can sympathize with people's pains, but not with their pleasures. There is something curiously boring about somebody else's happiness.

take place.quotation: Observe constantly that all things take place by change.

take up.author: John Wooden
take up.quotation: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.

tertiary.author: Karl Kraus
tertiary.quotation: Morality is a venereal disease. Its primary stage is called virtue; its secondary stage, boredom; its tertiary stage, syphilis.

themselves.author: Robin Williams
themselves.quotation: Good people end up in Hell because they can't forgive themselves.

though.author: Nelson Mandela
though.quotation: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.

through.quotation: But my experience is that people who have been through painful, difficult times are filled with compassion.

through to.quotation: Once you freeze all the way through to your soul, you will never feel warm again.

throw up.author: Ray Bradbury
throw up.quotation: Writing can be described in two verbs: Throw up and clean up.

tide.author: John F. Kennedy
tide.quotation: A rising tide lifts all the boats.

tiny.author: Dodie Smith
tiny.quotation: What a tiny list of friends I have! All my fault. I less and less want to see people.

tireless.author: Dalai Lama
tireless.quotation: I believe that constant effort, tireless effort, pursuing clear goals with sincere effort is the only way.

to this end.quotation: Medicine is aptly described as an art, not a science. To this end, four different doctors may have up to four different diagnoses or prescriptions.

trait.author: Nikola Tesla
trait.quotation: Anti-social behavior is a trait of intelligence in a world full of conformists.

trump.quotation: Maybe this is crazy, but I think the right to own a gun is trumped by the right not to be shot by one.

trump up.quotation: It is inappropriate for the Bush administration to trump up a case in which we are ballyhooed into war.

trumped-up.quotation: The trumped-up charges against kitsch and sentimentality should disturb us and make us suspicious.

turn out.author: John Dewey
turn out.quotation: All learning begins when our comfortable ideas turn out to be inadequate.

unconscious.author: Carl Jung
unconscious.quotation: The unconscious mind of man sees correctly even when conscious reason is blind and impotent.

underestimate.author: Vinnie Jones
underestimate.quotation: Never underestimate the predictability of stupidity.

undoubtedly.author: Bertrand Russell
undoubtedly.quotation: Undoubtedly the desire for food has been, and still is, one of the main causes of great political events.

unreliable.author: Joyce Meyer
unreliable.quotation: Our feelings are unreliable and cannot be trusted to convey truth.

unwilling.author: Ellen Swallow Richards
unwilling.quotation: The unwilling mind is not a teachable mind.

utmost.author: Mohamed ElBaradei
utmost.quotation: I have, as you know, the utmost respect for President Obama as a person.

vanish.author: Sanjay Dutt
vanish.quotation: I have lost 18 kg. Now if I lose anymore weight, I will vanish.

veer.author: Anita Shreve
veer.quotation: A single action can cause a life to veer off in a direction it was never meant to go.

venom.author: Alexander the Great
venom.quotation: May God keep you away from the venom of the cobra, the teeth of the tiger, and the revenge of the Afghans.

vicinity.author: Bertolt Brecht
vicinity.quotation: Impact lies in the vicinity of mistakes.

vote.author: Christabel Pankhurst
vote.quotation: How long you women have been trying for the vote. For my part, I mean to get it.

way out.author: Husayn ibn Ali
way out.quotation: When you are frustrated and do not know a way out, only flexibility and moderation towards difficulties will save you.

wear wore worn.author: Proverbs
wear wore worn.quotation: If every fool wore a crown, we should all be kings.

wee.author: Walter de La Mare
wee.quotation: Some one came knocking At my wee, small door; Some one came knocking, I'm sure‚Äîsure‚Äîsure.

whatever.author: Robert De Niro
whatever.quotation: Time goes on. So whatever you're going to do, do it. Do it now. Don't wait.

wipe.author: Tyga
wipe.quotation: Wake up everyday stronger than yesterday, face your fears and wipe your tears.

wise.author: William Shakespeare
wise.quotation: A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool.

work out.author: Buddha
work out.quotation: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.

youngster.author: Debbie Reynolds
youngster.quotation: I wasn't watching television when I was a youngster; there was the radio.
